client_profile: A couple looking to buy a 1+ room apartment in Brussels, budget 490000–895000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, family-friendly areas, and a residential, quiet environment.
must_have: Access to cafes and brunch spots
red_flags: High noise levels in some areas
Potential budget stretch in premium districts
Long commuting times in outer districts
contradictions: Desire for quiet but also needs locations with vibrant cafes
Family-friendly needs may limit proximity to lively restaurants
Budget constraints might limit desirable residential areas
Urban lifestyle may collide with preference for spaciousness

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Ixelles has diverse dining options and a lively cultural scene anchored by Flagey Square.
The area is family-friendly with parks such as Place Flagey for recreation.
watch_out: High property prices in trendy areas may exceed budget expectations.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
why: Etterbeek offers great access to parks like Parc du Cinquantenaire for family outings.
The area features many quiet streets with cafes and restaurants for relaxed living.
watch_out: Parking can be limited, especially near popular dining.
